summary: Script that makes creating completion functions much easier.
name: vimcompcrtr
description:
This plugin makes creating custom completion functions much easier.

Features:
  ∙ Ability to get variants from list and from dictionary keys
  ∙ Ability to get variants from custom function
  ∙ Allows modifying the completion description
install_details:
You can install this plugin using scriptmanager (vimscript #2905) plugin (install scriptmanager, call scriptmanager#Install(["vimcompcrtr"]) and add ``call scriptmanager#Activate(["vimcompcrtr"])'' to your .vimrc, then reload vim. Vim-addon-manager will install all dependencies for you). You can also use archives attached to this page, they contain plugin with all dependencies, so you do not need to fetch them yourself. Note that vimscript #3186's and this plugin's archives contain the same files.

Gentoo users can use the following mercurial overlay: http://vimpluginloader.hg.sourceforge.net:8000/hgroot/vimpluginloader/pluginloader-overlay.

versions.release_notes: Added input() completion support and simple `words' model (argument model that ignores context)
